Context Sentence EN: I’m not sure if I got the job yet.

Context Sentence EN: I know Viet is involved with a dangerous organization, but I still don't think that he has anything to do with the crime.

Context Sentence EN: If you ate blowfish without taking the poison out, it would be a matter of life and death.

Context Sentence EN: My husband told me I lack an awareness for maternal responsibilities and that made me super upset.

Context Sentence EN: You should be aware that you're also a member of society. I don't wanna be around people who lack self-awareness.

Context Sentence JP: 禁煙して三ヶ月になるけど、まだ時々煙草を吸いたいという衝動に駆られるね。興味深いことに、煙草が吸いたくなる時、自分ではそれをあまり自覚してないんだ。自分の人差し指を噛みしめているのに気づいて、ようやく自覚するんだよ。
Context Sentence EN: I’ve stopped smoking for three months now, but I still get the urge to smoke a cigarette every once in a while. Interestingly, when I really want to smoke, I’m not really aware of it. I only just realize it when I find myself chewing on my index finger.

Context Sentence EN: Kristen was just so cute when she was doing dishes and I couldn't help staring holes into her.

Context Sentence JP: 皿洗いをしている時は、時間が経つのがおそく感じます。
Context Sentence EN: I feel that time passes slowly when I'm washing dishes.

Context Sentence EN: Is it true that there is a ramen restaurant in Japan where you can wash dishes to pay your bill?

Context Sentence JP: ハリケーンのひがい者のために祈りました。
Context Sentence EN: I prayed for the hurricane victims.

Context Sentence EN: I don’t think many Japanese people know Japan’s national sport "sumo" used to be a ritual to pray for a bountiful rice harvest.

Context Sentence EN: A safety prayer charm was hanging from the car's rearview mirror.

Context Sentence EN: You can offer a prayer at either a shrine or a temple.

Context Sentence EN: Koichi can do the war dance of the Martians.

Context Sentence EN: "Why don’t you stay open later?" "Sorry, it’s not really my call. I just work here."

Context Sentence EN: The Japanese era name was altered to Tofugu.

Context Sentence EN: We caught more than enough fish ice fishing, so please take some if you'd like.

Context Sentence EN: There is an abundance of apples in our orchard.

Context Sentence JP: 他人の事情に首を突っ込むのは、まったく余計なお世話だってことは分かっていたんですが、つい好奇心に負けてしまいました。
Context Sentence EN: I knew it wasn’t really my business to be sticking my nose in other people’s affairs, but curiosity got the better of me.

Context Sentence EN: This is my personal opinion, but I hope Viet finds a good wife.

Context Sentence JP: アメリカ人の国民性なのか個人の問題なのかは分からないけど、コウイチはビールが大好きだよね。
Context Sentence EN: I don't know if it's because he's American, or if it's just him, but Koichi really loves beer, right?

Context Sentence JP: 個人主義と自分勝手の違いがよく分かりません。
Context Sentence EN: I don’t really see the difference between being an individualist and simply being selfish.

Meaning: One Small Thing, One Thing, One Small Object, One Object

Context Sentence EN: You've got one big hole in your back teeth.

Context Sentence EN: Those strawberries were one hundred yen each, but they flew off the shelves.

Context Sentence JP: 小さい子がいると個室い酒屋の存在はありがたいです。
Context Sentence EN: When you have small kids, the existence of izakaya with private rooms is appreciated.

Context Sentence EN: Koichi's been living in a shared house without his own room for more than five years now.

Context Sentence JP: 忘年会に個室を予約しました。
Context Sentence EN: I reserved a private room for our year-end party.

Context Sentence EN: I put three milks and three syrup cups in my coffee.

Context Sentence EN: I bought a box of soap that comes with three bars.

Context Sentence EN: After eating three cheeseburgers, three teriyaki burgers, and several nuggets, I feel really awful.

Context Sentence EN: Who knocked over the perforated ladle?

Context Sentence EN: I'm gonna bring him down, so don't worry too much.

Meaning: To Knock Over, To Knock Down, To Bring Down
Context Sentence JP: 日曜日、僕は父と一緒に木を何本か切り倒した後、それを叩き切って薪にしました。
Context Sentence EN: My dad and I knocked down some trees and chopped them up for logs this Sunday.

Context Sentence JP: 面倒な仕事をおし付けられたと思ったことは、一度もありません。
Context Sentence EN: I never once thought they'd given me troublesome tasks.

Context Sentence JP: こりゃまた面倒な仕事を引き受けたもんだね。
Context Sentence EN: You've taken on such a difficult job!

Context Sentence JP: 今に見てなさい。あのフグ少年はきっと面倒を引き起こすわよ。
Context Sentence EN: Mark my words. That Fugu boy is going to cause trouble.

Context Sentence EN: When I learned my company would go bankrupt, I looked up at the sky and saw a beautiful contrail.

Context Sentence JP: あの会社には、倒産の嫌疑がかかっている。
Context Sentence EN: That company is under suspicion of bankruptcy.

Context Sentence JP: 昨年はこの街だけで100余りの企業が倒産した。
Context Sentence EN: Last year there were more than a hundred bankruptcies in this city alone.

Context Sentence JP: そうは言っても、借り手が見つからない可能性もありますよね？
Context Sentence EN: Regardless of what you say, there's still a possibility that we won't be able to find a tenant, right?

Context Sentence JP: コウイチが昔住んでいた部屋だと言ったら、すぐに借り手が見つかりました。
Context Sentence EN: When we advertised that Koichi used to live here, the house went right away.

Context Sentence JP: あのマンションは、幽霊屋敷であるという評判のせいで借り手がつかない。
Context Sentence EN: That apartment still doesn’t have any tenants because it’s rumored to be haunted.

Context Sentence JP: どうやってこの厚いへいに穴が空いたんだろう。
Context Sentence EN: I wonder how a hole was made in this thick fence.

Context Sentence JP: トーフグオフィスをおとずれたさい、とても厚いもてなしを受けました。
Context Sentence EN: When I visited the Tofugu office, I received a very warm welcome.

Context Sentence JP: コウイチは、厚い苔の上で休んでいる病気のミミズを見つけた。
Context Sentence EN: Koichi found a sick earthworm resting on some thick moss.

Context Sentence JP: 圧力なべをばく発させてしまいましたが、幸いケガはありませんでした。
Context Sentence EN: I made the pressure cooker explode, but luckily I didn't get injured.

Context Sentence JP: ロケットが大気にとつ入するときの圧力は相当なものだ。
Context Sentence EN: The pressure that a rocket is under when it's entering the atmosphere is very strong.

Context Sentence JP: ワニカニがベータ版から脱するよう、我々はコウイチに圧力をかけ続けなくてはいけない。
Context Sentence EN: We must keep the pressure on Koichi to get WaniKani out of beta.

Context Sentence JP: お互い年だし血圧が上がっちゃうから、もう非難し合うのは止めにしない？
Context Sentence EN: Let's not play the blame game because we are both old and our blood pressure might go up.

Context Sentence JP: 低血圧だから朝起きられなくて困っているんです。今日は血圧をはかってもらったら、上が85で下が30でした。コウイチ先生、何とかしてもらえませんか？
Context Sentence EN: I am having trouble getting up in the morning because I have low blood pressure. When I had my blood pressure taken today, it was 85 over 30. Can you do something for me, Dr. Koichi?

Context Sentence JP: 血圧の薬を飲んでも血圧が高いままであることを医者に言うと、血圧を抑えるにはストレスを減らすことが重要だよと教えられました。
Context Sentence EN: When I told my doctor that I still have high blood pressure, even after taking blood pressure meds, he told me the importance of reducing stress to control it.

Context Sentence JP: 指圧はストレスや不安を和らげてくれます。
Context Sentence EN: Shiatsu massage can help with stress and anxiety.

Context Sentence JP: 指圧りょう法しのかれ氏が出来たけど、お金をはらわないと指圧してくれないんです。
Context Sentence EN: I got a boyfriend who is an acupressurist, but he won't give me a shiatsu massage unless I pay him.

Context Sentence JP: 指圧をしすぎると体に良くないこともあると言う人もいます。
Context Sentence EN: Some people say that getting too many shiatsu massages isn’t good for you.

Context Sentence JP: そもそも、この町には水害防止対さくが存在していなかったんだよ。
Context Sentence EN: There were no existing flood-control measures in this town to begin with.

Context Sentence JP: じゃあ、最初はオゾンそうに穴は存在していなかったんですか？
Context Sentence EN: So does that mean there were no holes in the ozone layer originally?

Context Sentence JP: 「コウイチさんが存在するとは思えない…」とフグは言った。
Context Sentence EN: "I can’t believe Koichi exists..." Fugu said.

Context Sentence JP: 現在一日に何件のメールを受信しますか？
Context Sentence EN: How many emails are you getting a day now?

Context Sentence JP: 穴ぐまって、実在するんですね。
Context Sentence EN: Badgers really exist, huh?

Context Sentence JP: どんな時に、神が実在すると感じますか。
Context Sentence EN: When do you feel that God really exists?

Context Sentence JP: トーフグの顔は、実在の人物をモデルに作られたという噂があります。
Context Sentence EN: There’s a rumor that Tofugu’s face was modeled after a real person.

Context Sentence JP: 在外し産はどのようにかん理していますか？
Context Sentence EN: How do you manage your overseas assets?

Context Sentence JP: 在外ほう人の安ぴはげん在確にん中です。
Context Sentence EN: We are currently checking on the safety of Japanese residents abroad.

Context Sentence JP: 在外投票をする前に、申し込み用紙を日本大使館か日本領事館に提出する必要があります。
Context Sentence EN: Before casting an overseas ballot, you have to submit an application to the Japanese embassy or the Japanese consulate.

Context Sentence JP: 穴をつくろうのに夢中な母のすがたを見て、うれしくなりました。
Context Sentence EN: I was happy to see my mom so absorbed in patching holes.

Context Sentence JP: 皿洗いの男に夢中のウェイトレスのことを好きになってしまったんだ。
Context Sentence EN: I fell in love with a waitress who is mad about a dishwasher.

Context Sentence JP: 「サーモン。あのさ、多分知らなかっただろうけど、高校生の頃、き、きみに夢中だったんだ。」「知ってたわよ。フグ。」
Context Sentence EN: "Salmon, well, you probably don't know this, but back in high school, I was, um, crazy about you." "I knew, Fugu."

Context Sentence JP: 主役が急病になったんだけど、代役が見つからなくてね。まさに悪夢だったよ。
Context Sentence EN: The lead actor got sick all of a sudden and we couldn't find another actor to fill in for him. It was such a nightmare.

Context Sentence JP: 太った猫になって歩けないという悪夢を見た。
Context Sentence EN: I had a bad dream that I turned into a fat cat that couldn’t walk.

Context Sentence JP: 腕を胸の前で組んで寝ると悪夢が見れるって聞いたから試したら、朝から晩までひたすらトイレ掃除をずっとしているという夢を見たよ。
Context Sentence EN: I heard you can make yourself have nightmares if you sleep with your arms folded across your chest, so I tried it and I had a dream that I was cleaning a toilet nonstop from morning to night.

Context Sentence JP: あなたは夢を売っているそうですが、一個いくらですか？
Context Sentence EN: I heard that you sell dreams. How much does one dream cost?

Context Sentence JP: 昨日、コウイチに指圧をしてもらっている夢を見たんだ。
Context Sentence EN: Yesterday, I had a dream that Koichi was giving me a shiatsu massage.

Context Sentence JP: 私の夢は漫画家になることです。叶うといいな。
Context Sentence EN: My dream is to become a manga artist. I hope it will come true.

Context Sentence JP: これ以上妨害するのを止めないと、えい業妨害でうったえるぞ！
Context Sentence EN: If you don't stop interfering, I'm going to sue you for obstruction.

Context Sentence JP: ここまで来れば、てきの妨害の危険はほぼ無いだろう。
Context Sentence EN: Since we've come pretty far, the risk of being intercepted by the enemy should be almost zero.

Context Sentence JP: 私はいつか映画のように公務執行妨害で逮捕されてみたい。
Context Sentence EN: Someday I want to be arrested for interfering with police officers, like in the movies.

Meaning: To Obstruct, To Prevent, To Hamper
Context Sentence JP: あの会社は、トーフグの成功を妨げようとしているらしい。
Context Sentence EN: I heard that company is trying to hamper Tofugu's success.

Meaning: To Obstruct, To Prevent, To Hamper
Context Sentence JP: 生産性を妨げるものは、すててしまった方がいいよ。
Context Sentence EN: You should get rid of things that obstruct productivity.

Meaning: To Obstruct, To Prevent, To Hamper
Context Sentence JP: どうして人々は宇宙人が地球にやってくる事を妨げようとするのか理解できません。
Context Sentence EN: I don’t understand why people try preventing aliens from reaching the earth.

Meaning: To Put On A Hat, To Wear A Hat
Context Sentence JP: 夏は外に出る時はぼうしを被らなくちゃ。
Context Sentence EN: We should put hats on when we go out in summer.

Meaning: To Put On A Hat, To Wear A Hat
Context Sentence JP: あそこでコナンのお面を被って無じゃ気にあそんでいるのがコウイチで、そのとなりでやさしく見守っているのがビエトです。
Context Sentence EN: The one with the Konan mask who is playing innocently is Koichi, and the other one next to him who is carefully watching over Koichi is Viet.

Meaning: To Put On A Hat, To Wear A Hat
Context Sentence JP: 大阪で雨の日に、中年のおばさんがビニール袋を被りながら自転車に乗っているのを見たことがあります。
Context Sentence EN: On a rainy day in Osaka, I saw a middle aged woman wearing a plastic bag on her head while riding a bicycle.

Context Sentence JP: 妻のたん生日に、水上飛行機をプレゼントしました。
Context Sentence EN: For my wife's birthday, I got her a seaplane.

Context Sentence JP: 妻がコウイチのコンサートに行ってきたんですが、最後尾の席だったけど、すごく良かったと言ってましたよ。
Context Sentence EN: My wife went to Koichi's concert and she said it was fantastic, though her seat was in the last row.

Context Sentence JP: 元妻が、「私みたいな女にはもう巡り合わないわよ」とか言うんだけどさ…っていうか、それが俺の計画なんですけど、みたいな？
Context Sentence EN: My ex-wife says, "You’ll never find someone like me." Well exactly! That’s the plan!

Meaning: Husband And Wife, Married Couple, Mr. And Mrs.
Context Sentence JP: その夫妻は、良い夫ふ関係には議論が必要かどうかについて、はげしく議論していました。
Context Sentence EN: That husband and wife had a long, heated argument on whether discussions are indispensable for a good married relationship.

Meaning: Husband And Wife, Married Couple, Mr. And Mrs.
Context Sentence JP: みんながコウイチ夫妻のことを非難がましい顔で見ていました。
Context Sentence EN: Everybody looked at Mr. and Mrs. Koichi with disapproval.

Meaning: Husband And Wife, Married Couple, Mr. And Mrs.
Context Sentence JP: フグ夫妻はともにとても口が達者で、近所の人達に大量の海藻を売りつけた。
Context Sentence EN: Mr. and Mrs. Fugu were such smooth operators that they sold tons of seaweed to their neighbors.

Meaning: Wife And Kids, Wife And Children
Context Sentence JP: 家では妻子がおなかをすかせて待っているんです。
Context Sentence EN: My hungry wife and children are waiting for me at home.

Meaning: Wife And Kids, Wife And Children
Context Sentence JP: コウイチは妻子ある身なのに毎晩行きつけのホステスのところに通っているんだよ。ひどいと思わない？
Context Sentence EN: Even though Koichi has a wife and kids, he visits his favorite hostess every night. Don't you think he's terrible?

Meaning: Wife And Kids, Wife And Children
Context Sentence JP: 新しい支店に転勤になって、やる気満々だよ〜。イイ男探しを日課に頑張ってます。妻子持ちだろうが関係ないかんね。笑
Context Sentence EN: Now that I’ve been transferred to the new branch store, I’m feeling really motivated. Working hard to find a good man has become one of my daily routines. I don’t care whether he has a wife and kids, you know? lol

Context Sentence JP: 日本もかつては一夫多妻がみとめられていました。
Context Sentence EN: Japan used to approve of polygamy too.

Context Sentence JP: 「一夫多妻せいとか、ありえないよな」とビエトが非難するように言うと、「その非難、自分に向けた方がいいんじゃねぇか？」とコウイチが笑って言い返した。
Context Sentence EN: "I can't believe polygamy exists," Viet said accusingly. "You can turn that finger around,” Koichi retorted with a smile.

Context Sentence JP: 全ての男性が一夫多妻制を支持する訳じゃない。
Context Sentence EN: It’s not like all men support polygamy.

Context Sentence JP: 嫌な仕事を嫌々するのは体に良くないよ。
Context Sentence EN: Reluctantly doing a job you don't like isn't good for your health.

Context Sentence JP: 嫌嫌嫌嫌嫌！無理無理無理無理無理！クモがいる！気持ち悪い！
Context Sentence EN: Ewwwwwww!!!! Nooooooo!!!! There is a spider! Gross!

Context Sentence JP: 「これ以上は安くできないよ。嫌ならやめて帰ってくれ。」 「分かったよ。買うことにするよ。」
Context Sentence EN: "That’s my final offer. If you don’t like it stop coming back." "Alright, alright. I’ll take it."

Context Sentence JP: 私の嫌いな穴うめ問題がテストに出ました。
Context Sentence EN: There were fill in the blank questions on the test, which I hate.

Context Sentence JP: 単じゅん作業は嫌いです。そんなものは機械にまかせるべきだと思います。
Context Sentence EN: I don't like busy work. I think we should have it done by machines.

Context Sentence JP: 色々と振り回してごめんなさい。嫌なやつと思ってるかもしれないけど、嫌いにならないで。
Context Sentence EN: I’m sorry to cause so many problems. You may think I’m unpleasant, but please don’t hate me.

Context Sentence JP: コウイチは、機械のように、毎日三時のおやつの時間になると機嫌が良くなる。
Context Sentence EN: Koichi gets in a good mood for three o'clock snack time, every day like clockwork.

Context Sentence JP: 今日のお母さんの機嫌はどう？
Context Sentence EN: What kind of mood is mom in today?

Context Sentence JP: 「彼女は朝、機嫌が悪いわね。」「ええ、全くその通りね。」
Context Sentence EN: "Her mood's terrible in the morning." "Yeah don’t I know it!"

Context Sentence JP: ビエトがヤクザだという嫌疑がぬぐえません。
Context Sentence EN: Our suspicion that Viet is a yakuza cannot be wiped away.

Context Sentence JP: 警察に嫌疑をかけられているんだ。
Context Sentence EN: I'm under suspicion from the police.

Context Sentence JP: ビエトがコウイチにかかった殺人の嫌疑を晴らした。
Context Sentence EN: Viet dispelled suspicions of Koichi being a murderer.

Context Sentence JP: 留守番電話にコウイチから明日飛行機でハワイに行くというメッセージが入っていました。
Context Sentence EN: On my answering machine, I got a message from Koichi saying he's flying to Hawaii tomorrow.

Context Sentence JP: あっちが留守番電話で議論をふかっけてきたんだぜ。
Context Sentence EN: He challenged me to a debate on my answering machine.

Context Sentence JP: トーフグのオフィスに何度も何度も電話をしていますが、いつも留守番電話です。
Context Sentence EN: I've been calling the Tofugu office over and over again, but I always get the answering machine.

Context Sentence JP: 日本では1950~1960年代にかけて、公害が大きな社会問題になりました。
Context Sentence EN: In Japan, pollution became a huge societal problem between 1950 and 1960.

Context Sentence JP: 私達はみんな、公害の加害者ですよ。
Context Sentence EN: We are all responsible for the pollution problems.

Context Sentence JP: 私の息子は、公害による呼吸器疾患に苦しんでいます。
Context Sentence EN: My son is suffering from a pollution-triggered respiratory illness.

Context Sentence JP: ビエトとダリンが、水害で飛んだデータをふく元しています。
Context Sentence EN: Viet and Darin are recovering the data that was lost from the water damage.

Context Sentence JP: その水害で、5,000びきの猫が家を失いました。
Context Sentence EN: The flood left 5,000 cats homeless.

Context Sentence JP: 私は、水害の起きやすい島で育ちました。
Context Sentence EN: I grew up on a flood-prone island.

Context Sentence JP: マグニチュード6.2の地震がありましたが、無害でした。
Context Sentence EN: There was an earthquake with a magnitude 6.2, but it was harmless.

Context Sentence JP: 無害のツイートにまでいちいちつっかかってるやつ、なんなの？
Context Sentence EN: What's with people who troll even harmless tweets?

Context Sentence JP: 心配しなくていいよ。トーフグに毒は無いから。彼は無害な河豚だよ。
Context Sentence EN: Don’t worry. Tofugu doesn’t have any poison. He’s a harmless blowfish.

Context Sentence JP: 高いところに行くと、お尻がかゆくなるんです。
Context Sentence EN: When I go to high places, my butt itches.

Context Sentence JP: 赤ちゃんのお尻ほど可愛いものはこの世に無い。
Context Sentence EN: There's nothing in the world that's cuter than a baby's butt.

Context Sentence JP: ほとんどの日本人が誕生日にお尻を叩くなんて聞いた事がないと思うよ。
Context Sentence EN: I bet most Japanese people have never heard of a birthday spanking.

Context Sentence JP: マリリンの猫の尻尾は、とてもフワフワです。
Context Sentence EN: Marilyn's cat's tail is very fluffy.

Context Sentence JP: だれも、タイソンに尻尾が生えていることには気づいていなかった。
Context Sentence EN: No one had noticed that Tyson had a tail.

Context Sentence JP: あの可愛い柴犬が、尻尾を振りながらコウイチに近づき、飛びついた。
Context Sentence EN: That cute Shiba came towards Koichi wagging its tail and jumped on him.

Context Sentence JP: 弓矢でシカを仕留めるには、にんたいがいります。
Context Sentence EN: You need to be patient if you want to shoot a deer with a bow and arrow.

Context Sentence JP: その夜、両親は、弓矢を売るべきかどうか議論しました。
Context Sentence EN: That night, my parents discussed whether or not to sell the bow and arrow.

Context Sentence JP: 昔はうさぎ狩りに弓矢を使っていました。
Context Sentence EN: We used to use bows and arrows for hunting rabbits.

Meaning: Forgotten Item, Something Forgotten, Forgotten Thing, Lost Property
Context Sentence JP: 単に忘れ物をしたことを非難してるわけじゃないんだよ。
Context Sentence EN: I'm not blaming you just because you forgot to bring something.

Meaning: Forgotten Item, Something Forgotten, Forgotten Thing, Lost Property
Context Sentence JP: コウイチの飛行機が成田空港に着いた時、コウイチは忘れ物に気づいたのでそのまま同じ飛行機でポートランドへと引き返しました。
Context Sentence EN: When Koichi's plane arrived at Narita Airport, Koichi realized that he forgot something, so he returned to Portland on the same airplane.

Meaning: Forgotten Item, Something Forgotten, Forgotten Thing, Lost Property
Context Sentence JP: 今日何か忘れ物をしたような気がするんだけど、それが何だったかをどうしても思い出せないんだよな。
Context Sentence EN: I feel like I forgot something today, but I just can’t remember what it is.

Context Sentence JP: こちらは、地面に穴をほる機械で、そちらは、はりの穴に糸を通す機械です。
Context Sentence EN: This is a machine for digging holes in the ground and that's a machine for threading needles.

Context Sentence JP: 今日は機械の調子があんまり良くないんだよね。
Context Sentence EN: Today the machine is not working very smoothly.

Context Sentence JP: コウイチは会社用にバッティングセンターの機械を買ったの？
Context Sentence EN: Did Koichi buy a batting cage machine for the office?

Context Sentence JP: 飛行機のチケット、もう取っちゃったんだよね。
Context Sentence EN: I've already booked the airplane tickets.

Context Sentence JP: 飛行機でコウイチのとなりの席になった時、めちゃくちゃこうふんしました。
Context Sentence EN: I was super excited when Koichi sat down next to me on the plane.

Context Sentence JP: 私は飛行機が苦手なので、一生日本に行けることはないでしょう。
Context Sentence EN: I dislike airplanes, so I would never be able to go to Japan.

Context Sentence JP: できるだけ早い危機のこく服を期待しています。
Context Sentence EN: I'm hoping they'll overcome this crisis soon.

Context Sentence JP: トーフグは今、危機的じょうきょうにあります。
Context Sentence EN: Tofugu is currently in a critical situation.

Context Sentence JP: 2008年の世界的な金融危機では、トーフグも経営難に陥ったのですか？
Context Sentence EN: Did Tofugu run into trouble during the global financial crisis of 2008?

Context Sentence JP: これは、災いを防いでくれるお守りです。
Context Sentence EN: This is a lucky charm that protects you from misfortune.

Context Sentence JP: 災い転じて福となすという言葉を信じてがんばりました。
Context Sentence EN: I believed in the phrase, "turn disaster into advantage," and it really worked.

Context Sentence JP: シャークは他人の災いを願っているようだね。
Context Sentence EN: It seems like Shark wishes misfortune upon other people.

Context Sentence JP: 自然災害ほどおそろしいものはありません。
Context Sentence EN: There is nothing scarier than natural disasters.

Context Sentence JP: そもそも、どうして災害が起こる可能性の高い場所に原子力発電所を建てたのかが理かいできません。
Context Sentence EN: I can't understand why they built the nuclear power plant on a potential disaster site to begin with.

Context Sentence JP: それぞれの部屋には、災害の場合に備えて懐中電灯とペットボトルのお水が何本か用意してあります。
Context Sentence EN: Each room has been prepared with flashlights and water bottles in case of a natural disaster.

Context Sentence JP: どうやって火災が大水害を引き起こしたの？
Context Sentence EN: How did a fire disaster cause heavy floods?

Context Sentence JP: 今日中に火災で空いた穴をふさがなくてはいけません。
Context Sentence EN: I have to fill the hole made by the fire disaster by the end of today.

Context Sentence JP: 彼は深夜二時に換気扇を回さずにフライパンでステーキを焼いて、火災警報装置を鳴らした。
Context Sentence EN: He cooked a steak in a frying pan without running the ventilation fan at 2AM and the fire alarm went off.

Context Sentence JP: 私は、運良く海外にいたので、その災難をまぬがれることができました。
Context Sentence EN: Fortunately, I was overseas at the time, so I was able to escape the disaster.

Context Sentence JP: 今日学校で、「災難は勇気を試す試金石である。」ということわざを習いました。
Context Sentence EN: Today at school I learned a proverb that goes, "calamity is the touchstone of a brave mind."

Context Sentence JP: どうしてあいつはあんなに災難に見舞われてばかりいるのかな？本当に偶然なのか、それともあいつ自体に何か問題があるんだろうか。
Context Sentence EN: I wonder why misfortune is always following that guy? Is it just by chance or is there something wrong with him?

Context Sentence JP: 震災で、地面が穴ぼこだらけになってしまいました。
Context Sentence EN: Because of the earthquake disaster, there are a lot of potholes on the ground now.

Context Sentence JP: 震災にあった日のことが、今でもわすれられないトラウマになっています。
Context Sentence EN: I still can't forget the trauma I experienced from the day of the earthquake disaster.

Context Sentence JP: 日本に行く時に、2011年の東北大震災の大津波に耐えた一本の松の木を見に行きたいです。
Context Sentence EN: When I go to Japan, I want to see the single pine tree that withstood the giant tsunami caused by the Great Tōhoku Earthquake in 2011.

Context Sentence JP: 山火事のせいで町中が煙くなっているんです。
Context Sentence EN: The entire town is smoky now due to the wildfire.

Context Sentence JP: 花火が煙くて、むせてしまいました。
Context Sentence EN: The smoky fireworks made me cough.

Context Sentence JP: 煙いなあ！一体いつになったら煙草やめるんだよ？本当に臭いんだけど。
Context Sentence EN: It’s so smoky! When the heck are you going to quit smoking? This really smells awful.

Meaning: To Commit A Crime, To Make A Mistake
Context Sentence JP: これから戦時中に犯した罪を告白します。
Context Sentence EN: I'm going to confess to the sin I committed during the war.

Meaning: To Commit A Crime, To Make A Mistake
Context Sentence JP: 法律を犯してまでするような事じゃないよね。
Context Sentence EN: I don't think it's worth doing if we have to break the law.

Meaning: To Commit A Crime, To Make A Mistake
Context Sentence JP: ビエトがミスを犯すことなどない。ビエトに不可能は無い。
Context Sentence EN: Viet is incapable of making mistakes. For Viet, nothing is impossible.

Context Sentence JP: 犯人と議論したんだけど、中々かみあわなくってね。
Context Sentence EN: I had an argument with the culprit, but I couldn't get anywhere.

Context Sentence JP: その犯人は、口は災いの元だということを思い知った。
Context Sentence EN: The criminal realized that the things he said truly were evil.

Context Sentence JP: 私は抜け目のない犯人にやられてしまったんだよ。私は全てを失って、犯人は指紋一つさえ残さなかったんだ。
Context Sentence EN: I’ve been struck by a smooth criminal. I lost everything and he didn’t even leave one fingerprint.

Context Sentence JP: あの共犯者は、まさに飛んで火にいる夏の虫だったな。
Context Sentence EN: The accomplice was indeed like a bug that flew into the fire in summer.

Context Sentence JP: 共犯者は国外に飛んでしまった可能性が高い。
Context Sentence EN: There is high probability that the accomplice has already fled the country.

Context Sentence JP: 彼はとても素晴らしい犯罪者で、自分一人でも、いとも簡単にとても危ない状態から抜け出すことが出来ました。そして、共犯者は一生必要ないとも豪語していました。
Context Sentence EN: He was a really wonderful criminal who could easily get out of the most dangerous situations by himself. He boasted that he would never need an accomplice.

Context Sentence JP: コウイチがあやまってこの穴に落ちる確率は、20%ぐらいだろうね。
Context Sentence EN: The probability of Koichi accidentally falling into this pit is at about 20%.

Context Sentence JP: コウイチが友情に厚い人である確率はどのぐらいだと思いますか？
Context Sentence EN: What's the likelihood of Koichi being someone who's kind to his friends?

Context Sentence JP: ビエトはコウイチに、トーフグが成功する確率は二百パーセントだと言いきった。
Context Sentence EN: Viet told Koichi that the chances of Tofugu succeeding were 200%.

Context Sentence JP: 機械ほんやくにはどれぐらいの比率でたよっていますか？
Context Sentence EN: What percent relies on machine translations?

Context Sentence JP: トーフグのオフィスの男女比率は、5:2です。
Context Sentence EN: The ratio of boys and girls in the Tofugu office is 5 to 2.

Context Sentence JP: トーフグの自己資本比率は100％だと思います。
Context Sentence EN: I think Tofugu has a capital-to-asset ratio of 100%.

Context Sentence JP: あの人、去年の冬に赤ちゃんを産んだばかりなのに今年の秋にもまた赤ちゃんを産むんですって。
Context Sentence EN: I heard that person just gave birth to a baby last winter and that she'll have another one this fall.

Context Sentence JP: カマキリが産んだたまごの中からたくさんの赤ちゃんカマキリが出てきました。
Context Sentence EN: A lot of baby mantises came out of the egg that the mantis laid.

Context Sentence JP: よし、もう一度いきむ準備はいいかい？君は双子の赤ちゃんを産むんだよ！ 大丈夫、大丈夫。頑張れ！君ならできるよ！
Context Sentence EN: Okay. You ready to push again? You are going to have twins! Okay, okay, come on, you can do it. You can do it!

Context Sentence JP: コウイチが百メートルほど飛ぶのを、この目で確かに見ました。
Context Sentence EN: I'm certain I saw Koichi fly about one hundred meters with my own eyes.

Context Sentence JP: この機械をそう作するのは確かに難しそうだね。
Context Sentence EN: It seems like it might be difficult to operate this machine.

Context Sentence JP: 確かにトーフグは、伝統的な日本語学習業界にダブルパンチを食らわせました。
Context Sentence EN: Tofugu has certainly delivered a one-two punch to the traditional Japanese language learning industry.

Context Sentence JP: コウイチはワニカニの正確なユーザー数を知りません。
Context Sentence EN: Koichi doesn't know the accurate number of WaniKani users.

Context Sentence JP: マイケルはコウイチのランチリクエストを正確に記おくし、注文するというにんむを終えました。
Context Sentence EN: Michael completed his mission to memorize Koichi's lunch request perfectly and order it.

Context Sentence JP: 君って、ああ言えばこう言うし、しかも言うことがどれもいちいち正確なのが結構頭にくるんだけど。
Context Sentence EN: Actually, I’m pretty annoyed at how you have a comeback for everything and how what you say is so accurate.

Meaning: Do Not Enter, No Entry, Off-Limits
Context Sentence JP: このドアには、関係者以外立入禁止って書かれているよ。
Context Sentence EN: This door says Authorized Personnel Only.

Meaning: Do Not Enter, No Entry, Off-Limits
Context Sentence JP: スーパーのバックヤードは立入禁止です。
Context Sentence EN: The backroom of the grocery store is off-limits.

Meaning: Do Not Enter, No Entry, Off-Limits
Context Sentence JP: それは大胆だね！君が本当に立入禁止って書いてる場所に入ってションベンしたなんて信じられないよ！
Context Sentence EN: That is wild! I can’t believe you went into a place marked "Do Not Enter" and then peed in there!

Context Sentence JP: はずかしくて、穴があったら入りたいよ！
Context Sentence EN: I am so embarrassed, I wished I could sink into the floor!

Context Sentence JP: あそこのほら穴には、コウモリが住んでいるらしいよ。
Context Sentence EN: I heard that bats are living in the cave.

Context Sentence JP: 彼が深くて素晴らしい穴を掘れるのは、持って生まれた才能です。
Context Sentence EN: He has the natural ability to dig deep, magnificent holes.

Meaning: Hole In The Wall, Little Known Good Place
Context Sentence JP: ここは、フグ料理の穴場なんですよ。
Context Sentence EN: This is a good blowfish restaurant, which isn't known to the public.

Meaning: Hole In The Wall, Little Known Good Place
Context Sentence JP: このい酒屋、カガヤって言うんだけど、東京でも穴場中の穴場だよ。
Context Sentence EN: This Izakaya restaurant is called Kagaya and this is one of the best holes in the wall in Tokyo.

Meaning: Hole In The Wall, Little Known Good Place
Context Sentence JP: あのことがあって以来、もう二度とああいう思いをしたくないし、周りにも迷惑をかけたくないので、フグ釣りの穴場に行くことは止めました。
Context Sentence EN: Ever since then I’ve never wanted to have that kind of experience again, or to cause trouble for others, so I’ve stopped going to the little-known place where you can fish for fugu.

Context Sentence JP: 「コウイチの鼻の穴の形ってちょっと変じゃない？」「そう？私はかわいいと思うけど。」
Context Sentence EN: "Aren't the shapes of Koichi's nose holes a bit weird?" "Really? I think they are cute."

Context Sentence JP: コウイチは、鼻血が出てくる時は鼻の穴にチクワをさしこんで止血します。
Context Sentence EN: When Koichi has a nose bleed, he sticks a tube-shaped fish paste cake in there to stop it.

Context Sentence JP: 「君の鼻の穴…。」「何？聞こえないわ。」「ええっと、やっぱり何でもないよ。大したことじゃないから。」「教えてくれなきゃだめよ。何を言おうとしてたの？」
Context Sentence EN: "Your nostril..." "What? I can’t hear you." "Well never mind. It’s nothing." "Now you have to tell me. What were you saying?"

Context Sentence JP: 穴子が減ってきたから、そろそろ注文しないといけないな。
Context Sentence EN: We are running short on conger eel, so we need to place an order for them soon.

Context Sentence JP: アメリカでは穴子は手に入りにくいので、代わりにウナギが使われています。
Context Sentence EN: Since it is difficult to get conger eel in America, freshwater eel is used instead.

Context Sentence JP: 「穴子の握り、もう一貫頼む？」「うん！あたり前田のクラッカーだよ。」
Context Sentence EN: "Do you want another piece of conger eel nigiri?" "Sure. Why not?"

Context Sentence JP: 時間が経つのを忘れて、ゲームに夢中になっていました。
Context Sentence EN: I was so into the game I didn't notice the time pass.

Context Sentence JP: トーフグができてから、もう何年経ちましたか？
Context Sentence EN: How many years have passed since Tofugu started?

Context Sentence JP: 「あいつら、幸せな結婚生活を送れると思う？」「時間が経てばわかるよ。」
Context Sentence EN: "Do you think they will have a happy marriage?" "Time will tell."

Context Sentence JP: 私は、飛行機で旅行をした経験がありません。
Context Sentence EN: I've never had the experience of traveling by plane.

Context Sentence JP: 友達を助けようとしたら、今度は非難のほこ先が自分に向いてしまうという経験をしたことがある人はいますか？
Context Sentence EN: Has anyone else had the experience where you try to help a friend and then you get blamed instead?

Context Sentence JP: 「そうだ、結婚カウンセリングは試してみたの？」 「もちろん、とっくに経験済みだわよ。でも、上手くいかなかったわ。」
Context Sentence EN: "Oh! Have you tried marriage counseling yet?" "Of course. We experienced that a long time ago but it went badly."

Context Sentence JP: 経験者から、価値あるアドバイスをいただくことができました。
Context Sentence EN: We were able to get valuable advice from an experienced person.

Context Sentence JP: やっぱり経験者はちがうね。
Context Sentence EN: As you'd expect, the experienced person's exceptional, isn't she?

Context Sentence JP: コウイチはトーフグに犯罪経験者を雇うと思いますか？
Context Sentence EN: Do you think Koichi would hire an experienced criminal at Tofugu?

Context Sentence JP: マミがコウイチのベーコンを食べた罪は思っている以上に重い。
Context Sentence EN: Mami's crime of eating Koichi's bacon is more serious than she thinks.

Context Sentence JP: 私の会社の社長は会計さぎの罪で有罪になった。
Context Sentence EN: My company president has been found guilty of accounting fraud crimes.

Context Sentence JP: コウイチは罪なき一般市民を殺害した人は雇わないと思うよ。
Context Sentence EN: I don’t think Koichi would hire anyone who has committed the crime of murdering innocent civilians.
